title: How to Make a Simple Animation in Adobe Flash

steps.headline: Choose frame 1 on the timeline which is located above the canvas.
Draw whatever you want to in your first frame (eg: a stick figure).
Choose the next frame depending upon the length of your animation.
steps.description: The larger the difference between the frames, the longer the animation.

steps.headline: Right click on the frame and click "Insert KEYFrame".
Right click anywhere between the first and the last frame and select "Create Motion Tween".
steps.description: Now the same picture you drew in the first frame will appear in the last frame you made.

steps.headline: Edit this picture in any way.
steps.description: You can change its size, position or other effects such as alpha, tint, etc. They appear when you right click on the object and click "Properties".

steps.headline: Press Ctrl+↵ Enter to view the animation.
Play around and experiment.
steps.description: There is a lot more to flash animation than just this.

tyn: Macromedia Flash MX or similar version of Macromedia Flash.
You can go to the Adobe website and download a one month version of Flash CS3 if you want to give Flash a try.
text: Open Macromedia Flash 10  Choose frame 1 on the timeline which is located above the canvas.  Draw whatever you want to in your first frame (eg: a stick figure).  Choose the next frame depending upon the length of your animation. The larger the difference between the frames, the longer the animation. Right click on the frame and click "Insert KEYFrame".  Right click anywhere between the first and the last frame and select "Create Motion Tween". Now the same picture you drew in the first frame will appear in the last frame you made. Edit this picture in any way. You can change its size, position or other effects such as alpha, tint, etc. They appear when you right click on the object and click "Properties". Press Ctrl+↵ Enter to view the animation.  Play around and experiment. There is a lot more to flash animation than just this.
